sub_title: Sr. Manager (interim), Operational Consultant, Mentor & Coach in Biotech, (Radio) Pharmaceutical, Cell & Gene, Medical Device, Food for Medical Purposes Industry
summary:
Adaptable, results-oriented Operations Support Specialist and Business Leader with more than 30 years of experience across multiple facets of operations including Project Management, Facilities Services, Maintenance, Engineering, Validation, Packaging and Supply Chain within highly regulated industries; Cell and Gene, Biotech, Pharmaceuticals, Radiopharmaceuticals, Medical Devices, and Food for Special Medical Purposes.

Adept at streamlining processes via the implementation of Lean Six Sigma concepts. Skilled in all stages of project life cycles from conception and design through execution and follow-up. Develops strategic plans and initiatives resulting in improved performance, increased revenue, and decreased cost. Provides valuable training in diversity and teamwork to overcome cultural barriers and cultivate a more productive environment. 

Motivates others to meet and exceed expectations. Fluent in Dutch, English, and German.

► Connect directly through Linkedin or Xing

Specialities: 
► Industrial Engineering, Maintenance, Facilities & Engineering Management.
► Sustainable growth creation, Change & Turnaround Management.
► Project Management, Portfolio Management, PMO. 
► Operational Excellence, Lean Six Sigma, 5S, Continuous Improvement.
► Supply Chain, Logistics, Warehouse & Distribution.
► Process, Packaging, Food, Food for Medical Purpose, Medical Nutrition, Medical Device, Cell and Gene, Biotech, Radiopharmaceuticals and pharmaceuticals.

projects.title: Retirement Planning & execution of a GMP-Facility
projects.description: Subject Matter Expert and PMO-Coordinator for the GMP-Compliant Retirement of a Manufacturing Facility in Germany for a Renowned Multinational Company. Planning & executing the shutdown of the manufacturing facility, the utilities & systems GMP compliantly, decommissioning the equipment & utilities, and the demolition & removal of all equipment, dry- and wet storage vessels, and infrastructure. Refurbishing the facility to be used as high-volume, high-throughput warehouse, including sewer systems and roadworks.

projects.title: Greenfield Development Hungary
projects.description: New hygiene Film Factory in a rural area, 45 miles North of Budapest, in a village called Rétsàg. Together with Ministry of Economic Affairs and a  Logistics Consultancy Company developed a long list of 17, reduced to a short list of 2, with a final selection for Rétsàg. Negotiated the buy of the agricultural plot, submitted the building & environmental permit, contracted two separate high-voltage powerlines to the plot. Selection & negotiations for the main contractor, the architect, and the local project management company.  Led the Project team for the design & construction of the facility, the hiring of local employees, and the training & development program to a successful inauguration by the ambassador for the USA in Hungary and start-up of the facility within 12 months after project kick-off.

profile_positions.description:
Change is the only constant factor, can't change that! Plenty of new ideas, but can we get away from old insights?

Consultancy, Interim & Project Assignments in Change Management, in Leadership and Management Setting; particularly in General, Engineering, Maintenance, Supply Chain and Facility Management in highly regulated environments; Biotech, Pharmaceutical, Radiopharmaceutical, Medical Devices, and Food for Special Medical Purposes.

Assisting Private Equity and Venture Capital Clients with Pharmaceutical Compliance Assessments for Business Process Restructuring (BPR)  and Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A).

Providing Clients with GxP-Compliant Facility and Location Retirement Planning & Execution Support Worldwide.
Providing Clients with Qualifying Supplier Audits according to GLP, OECD, GDP, GMP, and WHO, and follow up requalification audits Worldwide. 
Providing Consultancy Services on GxP Compliance according to FDA, EMA, and WHO, especially in Compliance, Validation, Qualification and Supply Chain, Warehousing, and Distribution for Warning Letter/Consent Decree remediation Worldwide. 

Maintenance, Validation & Calibration Systems Design Expertise for Highly Regulated Businesses such as Pharmaceutical, Radiopharmaceutical & Medical Device Industries, Biotech, and Food for Special Medical Purposes.

Industrial Masterplanning Expertise for Greenfield (new facilities in a new location) and Brownfield (refurbish existing; new facility at an existing location) Sites in Highly Regulated Environment; (Radio-)Pharmaceutical, Medical Devices Industry, Biotech, and Food for Special Medical Purposes Worldwide.

Leachable & Extractable Expertise in Pharmaceutical setting for Immediate Packaging Systems
profile_positions.title: Managing Partner / Owner

profile_positions.description:
At Quality Executive Partners (QxP), our mission is to bring bold revolution to quality consulting. We are fuelled by the passion for doing what is right and being the much needed disruptive innovation! There may be nothing revolutionary about passion, but we turn that passion into real value, built on integrity and long-term client partnerships. And, in our industry, that is revolutionary.

The QxP team is comprised of executives with extensive track records delivering successful outcomes in situations of intense regulatory scrutiny. Our executives have substantial experience interacting and negotiating with FDA and other global regulatory agencies. We take a pragmatic, strategic view of internal processes, quality system development, and implementation of key matters. Our approach is to “do and teach.” We assist our clients in developing Quality and Compliance organizations and leaders, all while getting real work done.

My expertise is in Engineering Services, Equipment Qualification, Maintenance, Supply Chain, Warehousing & Distribution. I perform audits, identify gaps, and develop remediation plans. I work within the organization to assist with deviation investigations and CAPA implementation; the focus is on developing scientific, risk based solutions. I have in-depth knowledge of US and EU regulations.

profile_positions.title: QA Validation Specialist (Contract)

profile_positions.description:
As CMC & Supply Manager responsible for Validation oversight and Support to drive the technical development of 177-Lutetium and 111-Indium based radiopharmaceuticals in clinical development for Diagnostic and Therapeutic Cancer Treatment.

OctreoPharm Sciences GmbH is part of Ipsen S.A. developing Systemic Radiation Therapies (SRT). Systemic therapy involves treatment that travels through your entire body rather than being aimed at one area. Systemic radiation therapy uses radioactive drugs to treat certain types of cancer, including thyroid, bone, and prostate cancer. These are liquid drugs made up of a radioactive substance. Although these drugs travel through your whole body, they can find and collect in places where the cancer cells are located. This helps them deliver radiation doses exactly to the tumour or area where the cancer cells are found. Some belong to PRRT, peptide receptor radionuclide therapy. This treatment combines radioactive material with a peptide to make a radiopeptide. When given, the radiopeptide finds and attaches to certain types of cancer cells, then delivers a high dose of radiation directly to the cells.
profile_positions.title: CMC & Supply Manager (contract)

profile_positions.description:
Supporting the department manager and the team members, after a challenging period in which the Validation team was stretched for resources and competencies, to return to steady-state.

Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies or increasing productivity in their laboratories, we are here to support them.

The Groningen site specializes in cGMP for (pre)clinical and commercial manufacturing, including mammalian cell culture manufacturing, scale-up and cGMP manufacturing of recombinant proteins and monoclonal antibodies. Additionally, late-stage process development services include:
In-house analytical capabilities, QC and QA
Fed-batch and perfusion processes
Experience with all mammalian cell lines
Single-Use and flexible stainless steel technologies

Groningen has a strong regulatory and inspection history, beginning in 1994 and is part of Patheon's global network of biologics sites, which also includes Princeton, New Jersey, St. Louis Missouri, USA, and Brisbane, Australia. 

Our global team of more than 75,000 colleagues delivers an unrivalled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services and Patheon.

profile_positions.title: Validation Manager (contract)

profile_positions.description:
As Facilities, Maintenance & Engineering Specialist, adhering to GEP Guidelines, developing, delivering, and training GMP-compliant processes, procedures, and instructions. Among others, Facilities Cleaning, Preventative, Predictive, and Corrective Maintenance, also Asset Life Cycle Management. Review, modify and implement various Engineering policies and procedures, aligned with other Facilities programs and regulations; Minor Miscellaneous Projects and CapEx Project processes and procedures, in close collaboration with  Corporate and Similar Kite Pharma sites across the Globe.

About Kite Pharma, A GILEAD Company
Kite is a biopharmaceutical company engaged in the development of innovative cancer immunotherapies with a goal of providing rapid, long-term durable response and eliminating the burden of chronic care. The company focuses on chimeric antigen receptor (CAR), and T cell receptor (TCR) engineered cell therapies designed to empower the immune system's ability to recognise and kill tumours.
Kite Pharma Europe is currently building a state-of-the-art manufacturing site in the Netherlands (Amsterdam-Hoofddorp) as it focuses on developing the European Region in support of providing maximum access to patients with unmet needs.
profile_positions.title: Facilities, Maintenance & Engineering Specialist

profile_positions.description:
As Manager Engineering responsible for building up and leading the engineering team for the newly built manufacturing site in Hoofddorp (NL). In this role, my team of engineers and specialists are responsible for the engineering tasks, CapEx project execution support, third line support and maintaining and developing engineering knowledge and standards for Kite’s commercial manufacturing site producing autologous T cell therapy products.
•	Responsible for complex Engineering programs with global reach.
•	Leading the day-to-day activities of the engineering department.
•	Review, modify and implement various Engineering policies and procedures, aligning with regulations and (global) facilities programs.
•	Project involvement as a senior people manager with a focus on operational resource management.
•	Ensures projects are executed safely, efficiently, and follow all applicable codes and Kite/Gilead Standards.
•	Provide expert advice to managers regarding technical maintenance, operations or management issues.
•	Managing the engineering services including interface with external contractors and vendors.
•	Building an effective Engineering team and ensuring that all personnel are fully aligned to their customer needs and requirements, providing an excellent level of service.

About Kite Pharma, A GILEAD Company
Kite is a biopharmaceutical company engaged in the development of innovative cancer immunotherapies with a goal of providing rapid, long-term durable response and eliminating the burden of chronic care. The company focuses on chimeric antigen receptor (CAR), and T cell receptor (TCR) engineered cell therapies designed to empower the immune system's ability to recognise and kill tumours.
Kite Pharma Europe is currently building a state-of-the-art manufacturing site in the Netherlands (Amsterdam-Hoofddorp) as it focuses on developing the European Region in support of providing maximum access to patients with unmet needs.
profile_positions.title: Engineering Manager a.i.

profile_positions.description:
In a very fast (double digit’s) growing organisation collaborating with Supply Chain, Materials Management, Manufacturing, IT, HR, and Finance, to build the system, processes, and procedures for Facilities, Maintenance & Engineering in support of the launch of the Yescarta Manufacturing Facility in Hoofddorp later in 2019.
With guidance from the Facilities & Engineering Mission: Deliver and maintain safe, reliable facilities that are compliant, cost-effective, and sustainable through a collaborative environment that is focussing on teamwork and best-in-class process. 

Kite Pharma, a Gilead company, is dedicated to achieving one of the most ambitious goals of 21st-century medicine: Curing Cancer. This mission is at the heart of everything we do, from early research to product development. Today, Kite is a leader in engineered T-cell therapy, changing the paradigm of cancer treatment with what is potentially the biggest breakthrough since the introduction of combination chemotherapy more than 60 years ago. With an unrelenting drive and a singular focus on cell therapy, we want to bring life-saving therapies to patients.
